intro: Saccolabiopsis tenella, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments in eastern North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shallow water or damp soil, and its rhizomes help it spread vegetatively. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences that produce tiny, wind-pollinated flowers.
